alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 28 at 3:29PM CDT until October 29 at 4:52AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by heavy rainfall rates is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Harris. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...A line of storms is currently pushing through the area and will produce 1 to 2 inches of rain in a quick time period. Construction zones and urban streets with poor drainage may experience some street flooding as a result. The precipitation is moving at a good pace so excessive amounts are not anticipated, but any standing water will take a while to recede. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pasadena, Pearland, League City, northwestern Baytown, northeastern Friendswood, Deer Park, Alvin, South Houston, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Webster, Manvel, Cloverleaf, South Belt / Ellington, Greater Hobby Area, Channelview, Clear Lake, Second Ward, Greater Eastwood and Greater Fifth Ward. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
